name: 電子化人力資源研究
comment: 如果本校大三大四學生想修此全英語授課課程，請找任課教師拿授權碼。
description: This course provides a thorough introduction to the field of electronic human resource management/development (e-HR), a combination of two major management fields that impact the competitive advantage of companies, human resources and technology. In this course, students will learn 1) the potential value and current capacity of technology in various human resource functions, 2) how to design and implement technology to maximize company's HR, 3) how to move from data to information to help the HR provide strategic value to stakeholders, and 4) what are the possible impact of emerging technology such as social media, big data and artificial intelligence on HR. This course is conducted using a combination of lectures, student presentations, hands-on practices and case studies.
goals: Describe the concepts of e-Human Resource and current applications.
Explain how information technology supports each functional process of human resource management, e.g., recruiting, training, compensation, etc.
Use workforce analytics to produce human resource metrics
Critically evaluate e-HR systems, applications and venders to make acquisition decisions.
Discuss issues in system implementation and change management process.
Describe emerging technological trends in the human resource function, e.g., AI.

Week 1

Course introduction, introduction to e-HR, syllabus review

Week 2

Week 3

Week 4

Week 5

Week 6

Week 7

Spring break

Week 8

Week 9

e-HR project proposal presentation

Week 10

Week 11

Week 12

Week 13

Week 17

Speech

methodologies.note: Benefits and challenges of e-HR practices will be introduced, as well as the current status of HR technology and e-HR adoption issues.
Students will discuss related issues and trends introduced by the instructor and research topics presented by fellow students.
Students will collaborate on a case study of e-HR.
Students will select a benchmark company and conduct a case study of their e-HR adoption and practices.
Students will complete in-class and take-home exercises such as a simple HR database and reports, a workforce analytics report, etc.

grading.note: Students will complete in-class and take-home exercises on 1) designing a simple HR database and reports; 2) workforce analytics report.
Students are expected to come to each class prepared to discuss the readings and assignments and to play an active role in contributing to class discussions.
Class attendance is absolutely essential. Please come to the class on time and notify the instructor ahead of time if you will be late or absent for a class.

Each student will present assigned readings and lead a discussion of the key points each week. The student responsible for the presentation should email a completed Powerpoint file with a list of discussion questions to the instructor the night before class.

Students will form groups to complete a case analysis report on the e-HR practices of a selected benchmark company. To complete the report student should conduct a field research on an industry-leading company to find out how e-HR supports its success.  Recommendations for improvement in e-HR processes will be encouraged and extra points will be given to this additional effort. An oral presentation of the case report in Powerpoint should also be prepared.
